    [WINDOWS 10 FIX] Chinese Input Method Shows Traditional Chinese Characters Rather Than Simplified Ones

    A step-by-step guide on fixing the Windows 10 Chinese input method to display Simplified Chinese characters instead of Traditional ones.

    less than 1 minute read

    1. Home
      2. /
    2. Windows
      3. /
    3. Troubleshooting
      4. /
    4. [WINDOWS 10 FIX] Chinese Input Method Shows Traditional Chinese Characters Rather Than Simplified Ones

    Matthew Choo

    With 20 years in market research across Telco and Media, I’ve decoded consumer behavior, optimized research, and driven data-led strategies.     • Email

    Finally found how to resolve this.

    Steps:

    1.  At the bottom left, SEARCH box, type LANGUAGE

    2.  (if not done) choose ADD A LANGUAGE, Add SIMPLIFIED CHINESE.

    3.  Choose SIMPLIFIED CHINESE to expand the option box, choose OPTION.

    4.  Under KEYBOARD, select MICROSOFT PINYIN to expand the option box, choose OPTION.

    5.  Choose GENERAL option

    6.  Under CHOOSE A CHARACTER SET, select SIMPLIFIED CHINESE.  

    7.  DONE

    Tags: Chinese Input, Fix, Language Settings, Simplified Chinese, Windows 10

    Categories: Troubleshooting, Windows

    Updated: April 15, 2020
